arm_group.arm_group_label: the patients with open partial nephrectomy
arm_group.description: the adult patients with open partial nephrectomy
the adult patients with laparoscopic partial nephrectomy
the adult patients with VAMS partial nephrectomy
the adult patients with robotic partial nephrectomy

brief_summary.textblock:
Urinary Neutrophil gelatinase associated lipocalin (NGAL) has been recently reported to be
      related with the degree of acute kidney injury. We are trying to analyze whether it is
      related with the grade of acute kiney injury after partial nephrectomy and there is any
      difference between the kinds of surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Acute Renal Injury During Partial Nephrectomy Using Neutrophil Gelatinase-associated Lipocalin (NGAL): Prospective Comparative Study Between Open, Video-assisted Minilaparotomy, Laparoscopic, and Robotic-assisted Laparoscopic Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. adults patient more than 20 years old with ASA score 1-3

          2. the patients who undergoing partial nephrectomy for the renal mass less than 7 cm

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. the patient with previous history with renal surgery

          2. the patient with bilateral partial nephrectomy

          3. the patient with synchronous operation for other intraperitoneal surgery

          4. the renal mass more than 7 cm

          5. previous kinds of surgery is changed into other kinds due to bleeding, etc

          6. the patient with serum Cr level more than 1.4 mg/dl

          7. the patient who does not understand the consent form

study_pop.textblock:
1. the adult patients with open partial nephrectomy

          2. the adult patients with laparoscopic partial nephrectomy

          3. the adult patients with VAMS partial nephrectomy, 4: the adult patients with robotic
             partial nephrectomy

clinical_study.keyword: acute kidney injury, partial nephrectomy, biomarker

facility.name: Department of Urology, Urological Science Institute, Yonsei University, Colleage of Medicine

primary_outcome.description: Analysis of correlation between the level of preoperative and postoperative urinary NGAL
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from Preoperative, postop 3hr, 24hr, 48hrs after partial nephrectomy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
